meta.name: description
meta.content: CDC is closely monitoring an outbreak of respiratory illness caused by a novel (new) coronavirus (termed “COVID-19”). This page has Maricopa County-specific updates and guidance.

link.script: setEditorVariables(false, 840); function getPrintPreviewType() { return 0; } function printPreview() {pPreview(getPrintPreviewType()); }

a.style: border-left: 1px solid #635e65; border-right: 1px solid #000000;background: #030303 url(/Common/images/AlertCenter/alertBarBlackTextBckg.png) repeat-x; color: #FFFFFF;

span.a: An Excessive Heat Warning is in effect through 8:00 p.m. Thursday, April 30 Stay safe in the extreme heat, visit HeatAZ.org.

div.class: inner col col24 first last iddfa306b4-939b-498a-b098-cce65a0a8c55
inner col col24 first last ide43ae870-70f1-48f9-b236-6a164fa82d0e
inner col col6 first last id77a0aa5b-0979-4ede-b87d-87f5f47f893d
inner col col6 first last idc65c10de-69f6-4c66-afbf-e741c68c6a1c
inner col col6 first last id84f1724b-a5ea-475e-9eab-1c26b90f90c5
inner col col6 first last id48c510ec-74f2-4926-b8b4-c84472bcd03a
inner col col24 first last ida3a5ba7a-40b0-4a66-8714-78375cdf70a6

p.em:
1. Total number of cases are cumulative. Case numbers include only those that have been lab-confirmed and include hospital and ICU admissions.
Note: Maricopa County daily counts may vary slightly from
due to differences in data reporting download times.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id3eb7d0e4-7ff7-46e1-9c6d-76c715e9636c

ul.li: People aged 65 or older or those who have at least one chronic health condition make up 73% of those who have been hospitalized and 97% of deaths for COVID-19.
Supporting those at the highest risk for severe disease is essential so that they can stay home and away from others.
The number of COVID-19 hospitalizations are leveling off. This trend indicates social distancing measures seem to be working and we need to continue our efforts to keep flattening the curve.

div.class: inner col col5 first last id32e51bbd-86f9-4bcc-a81e-b189aa5cb12f
inner col col14 first last idde1540f0-cb39-4bc5-a65c-da33b2003e1a

a.aria-label: View Additional COVID-19 Data for Maricopa County opens in new window

span.span: View Additional COVID-19 Data for Maricopa County

div.class: inner col col14 first last id9a2d03e4-4943-44cd-9cc6-6c2c69ca704c
inner col col5 first last id531f23ca-549b-433c-a12e-75ea27d6d807
inner col col24 first last id714a29f8-620c-4b0f-896b-a1907af964eb

ul.li: For medical questions related to COVID-19, please call 1-844-542-8201. For questions about community resources such as food or housing or if you are an employer with questions, please dial 2-1-1.
Maricopa County Unified Command Works to Secure More Personal Protective Equipment
Governor Ducey Announces Antibody Tests For Health Professionals, First Responders
Governor Ducey Issues Executive Orders for Enhanced Surveillance and On-the-Job Training for Assisted Living Facility Caregivers
The CDC has issued guidance on the use of face coverings to slow the spread of COVID-19. The guidance includes information on how to make, use, and sterilize your own face coverings.
We are accepting donations of PPE to supply local hospitals and clinics with the personal protective equipment they need.
An Executive Order is currently in effect for Arizonans to stay at home while encouraging alternative ways to stay connected with friends and loved ones.
Arizona school closures have been extended through the end of the school year.
Maricopa County Department of Public Health is recommending the cancellation of non-essential large gatherings of more than 10 people through May 10, 2020.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id47aaa951-9987-4531-ad45-4c49c751a7ae

h4.a: Maricopa County Increases Efforts to Assist Homeless Population

div.class: inner col col8 first last idea68af77-adc1-47e3-9c0f-2d2ee73b6686
inner col col8 first last idfdf4f531-5aec-4437-9430-ea5139ee2560

img.alt: Graphic illustrating how contact tracing works.

h4.a: Maricopa County Preparing to Expand Contact Tracing

div.class: inner col col8 first last id72a16c13-d250-443b-9ea4-738756c7434d

h4.a: Maricopa County Preparing to Expand Contact Tracing

li.div: Maricopa County Department of Public Health is preparing to increase its capacity to contact people who have been exposed to COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: Maricopa County Unified Command Works to Secure More Personal Protective Equipment

li.div: Maricopa County Unified Command has distributed more than half a million pieces of personal protective equipment (PPE) to date, but requests continue to pour in. Read on...

h4.a: Maricopa County and Community Partners Provide Resources to People in Crisis

li.div: Maricopa County’s Community Organizations Active in Disaster group (COAD) is stepping up to provide support services to residents in coordination with Maricopa County’s efforts. Read on...

div.class: inner col col24 first last id9cd05d79-0ab7-46f1-a9eb-53a882b7f5e6
